lead_paragraph: In interviews, the president stresses big achievements without big mistakes. But a low-key approach and public perceptions are hampering him.

headline.print_headline: Obama Is Lobbying for a Positive Legacy
headline.main: Obama Lobbies for an Appreciation of His Legacy

snippet: In interviews, the president stresses big achievements without big mistakes. But a low-key approach and public perceptions are hampering him.
abstract: Washington Memo; Pres Obama has given two interviews in which he has reflected on legacy of his presidency, both revealing his frustration that American public views his achievements in lesser light than he does; while Obama has achieved much, difficulty in conveying that to American public is in part that he is essentially trying to prove a negative--that the country would be in far worse condition had he not been at helm during series of crises.
